character.name: Lucius Claudius Corvus
character.symbolic_representation: Strategic architect; identity suppression; intellect without conscience
character.brief_description: Brutus's second-in-command and strategic architect — a Romanized Gaul whose calculated ambition and intellectual mastery drive Rome's operations in Jerusalem.
character.full_description: The Raven is a strategic architect of Rome's operations in Jerusalem. Born in Lugdunum to a Gallic warrior who allied with Rome, Corvus grew up between two identities, belonging fully to neither. He chose Rome with full awareness. As Brutus's second-in-command for five years, he is the intellect behind Brutus's authority — and both know it. His ambition to surpass Brutus is carefully managed; his suppressed Gallic heritage surfaces only in dangerous moments. The crucifixion is a strategic operation executed with precision. What follows will dismantle the framework he has built his entire identity inside.
character.opening_state: Well-groomed, comfortable appearance; appears as helpful problem-solver; already predatory
character.key_transformation: Visibly wealthier; monopolies established; mask maintained; predatory nature revealed
character.closing_state: Wealth evident in every detail; comfort with chaos as profit opportunity; economic predator fully revealed
character.arc_preview: From apparent pragmatic administrator solving problems, through systematic economic exploitation and coordination with other Arcani, to revealed economic predator profiting from desperation and collapse
